situation: P was becoming agitated during a noisy group activity. He started to scream and aggressively swat at nearby objects.
action: The teacher raised her voice to tell P to calm down, which added to the noise and increased his distress. No effort was made to move P from the source of the noise or provide sensory tools.
effect: P's behavior escalated further until he had to be removed from the classroom. The reaction did not alleviate his sensory overload and instead exacerbated the situation.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
